result.execSummary:
The defendant Breionea L Lovett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Defendant has already completed, but must provide proof to court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Breionea L Lovett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: (Fax) Dated 12/17/15, from Atty Williams Buttery to Judge Carter, with attached verification of community service.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Breionea L Lovett in court with Attorney Nicole Williams Buttery.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Williams Buttery makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  FINE:  $389.00 - to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 12/1/15, alternate 8 days jail if not paid.
 
                    20 Hours of Community Service  (Defendant already completed but needs to provide proof)

  Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of payment of all costs/fees and completion of community service and no new criminal law violations.

Plea/sentencing hearing at 10-19-2015 11:00 am
